intro: Setaria crus-ardeae, commonly known as the red panicgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically reddish in color, contributing to its common name. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and fields. Setaria crus-ardeae is adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions, making it a resilient and widespread species.
